intro: Cnestis obliqua, commonly known as the African bluebell, is a flowering plant native to regions of Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with opposite, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed habitats. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and floral arrangements.
